name: silicon tetrachloride production | carbon monoxide | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2/documentation

Production of silicon tetrachloride production by chlorination method using silica sand as raw material.

The activity starts when the raw materials enters the process.

Materials entering the process are included as well as energy uses, infrastructure and emissions.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Silicon tetrachloride production by chlorination method using silica sand (SiO2) as raw material.; The amount of silicon dioxide (SiO2), carbon and chlorine (Cl2) entering the process is calculated via stoichiometric equation. The efficiency of the reaction is assumed to be 95%, thus the amount of all the substances entering the process is multiplied by (1/0.95). In the case of sodium dioxide the unreacted amount is assumed to be released as solids, inorganic as a part of wastewater. The unreacted amount of carbon is assumed to be converted within the boundaries of the activity into carbon dioxide (either during air emission treatment - flaring or during wastewater treatment). 0.2% of the imput amount of chlorine is assumed to be emitted into the air. Remaining amount of unreacted chlorine is released as chloride as a part of wastewater. It is assumed that internal wastewater treatment is a part of the activity. Its efficiency is assumed to be 90%, thus only 10% of the unreacted amount of substances which are present in the wastewater are lately released into the environment.;(Seo, E.S.M.; Andreoli, M.,; Chiba, R.; 2001, Silicon tetrachloride production by chlorination method using rice husk as raw material)

flow.name: carbon monoxide
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

exchanges.description: Calculated values. It is assumed, that the whole unreacted volume of silica sand on the input of the acticity is released as a part of wastewater. The efficiency of the waste water treatment plant (WWTP) is assumed to be 90%, i.e. 10% of the volume of silica sand on the inflow to the WWTP is released to the environment as solids, inorganic and 90% is collected by the sand filter which is part of the WWTP and further on treated as inert waste and deposited on a landfill.

defaultProvider.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

exchanges.description: I has been assumed, that the whole unreacted volume of silica sand on the input of the acticity is released as a part of wastewater. The efficiency of the waste water treatment plant (WWTP) is assumed to be 90%, i.e. 10% of the volume of silica sand on the inflow to the WWTP is released to the environment as solids, inorganic.

In case of chlorine (Cl2), part of the unreacted volume evaporates as emission to air (0.2% of the input), the rest is released as chloride (Cl-) as a part of wastewater. The efficiency of the waste water treatment plant (WWTP) is assumed to be 90%, i.e. 10% of the volume of chloride on the inflow to the WWTP is released to the environment (river). The amount of chloride which is released to the environment is calculated based on knowledge of the amount of unreacted chlorine which does not evaporates into air and molecular weight of both elements.
Stoichiometric calculation. Yield is assumed to be 95%.

exchanges.description: Data from a large chemical plant in Germany (Gendorf, 2000), calculated based on overal cooling water consumption per kilogram of product. This plant produces several different products.

Calculated values. It is assumed, that the whole unreacted volume of silica sand on the input of the acticity is released as a part of wastewater. The efficiency of the waste water treatment plant (WWTP) is assumed to be 90%, i.e. 10% of the volume of silica sand on the inflow to the WWTP is released to the environment as solids, inorganic and 90% is collected by the sand filter which is part of the WWTP and further on treated as inert waste and deposited on a landfill.

exchanges.description: Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.
Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.
Stoichiometric calculation. Yield is assumed to be 95%. Silica sand is assumed to have 85% of SiO2 (molar weight = 60.084 g/mol).
